title: Instance of 'Index' has no 'tz' member

labels.name: Needs astroid Brain ðŸ§
labels.description: Needs a brain tip in astroid (then an astroid upgrade)

labels.name: False Positive ðŸ¦Ÿ
labels.description: A message is emitted but nothing is wrong with the code

labels.name: Lib specific ðŸ’…
labels.description: This affect the code from a particular library

labels.name: Needs PR
labels.description: This issue is accepted, sufficiently specified and now needs an implementation

body:
### Bug description

When running `pylint` (tested with versions 2.8.3 and 2.10.2) on a Python script with a `DatetimeIndex` variable, `pylint` raises an error when the `tz` attribute of the variable is being accessed. The errors are:

```bash
E1101: Instance of 'ExtensionIndex' has no 'tz' member (no-member)
E1101: Instance of 'Index' has no 'tz' member (no-member)
```

This is a bug since `date_range` returns a [`DatetimeIndex`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.date_range.html) object, which have a [`tz`](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DatetimeIndex.tz.html) attribute.

#### Reproduction steps

Create a script `index_tz_member.py` with the following lines:

```python
import pandas as pd

days = pd.date_range("2021-08-01", "2021-08-31")
assert days.tz is None
```

This bug does not appear if using `pandas==1.2.4`.

This bug seems related to https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/3344

### Configuration

_No response_

### Command used

```shell
pylint index_tz_member.py
```


### Pylint output

```shell
E1101: Instance of 'ExtensionIndex' has no 'tz' member (no-member)
E1101: Instance of 'Index' has no 'tz' member (no-member)
```


### Expected behavior

No error being raised by pylint.

### Pylint version

```shell
pylint 2.10.2
astroid 2.7.2
Python 3.8.10 (default, Jun  2 2021, 10:49:15)
```


### OS / Environment

Ubuntu 20.04

### Additional dependencies

pandas==1.3.2
